title: Date()
c
creates a
Date
c
instance containing the current time (up to milliseconds) and date.

inline_content.Text: instance containing the current time (up to milliseconds) and date.

title: Date(m)
c
creates a
Date
c
instance containing the time and date corresponding to the Epoch time (1 January, 1970 UTC) plus
m
c
milliseconds. Example:
new Date(749019369738)
c
gives the date
Sun, 26 Sep 1993 04:56:09 GMT
i

inline_content.Text: instance containing the time and date corresponding to the Epoch time (1 January, 1970 UTC) plus

title: with two or more integer arguments
b

inline_content.Text: with two or more integer arguments

title: Date(i1, i2, i3, i4, i5, i6)
c
reads the arguments as year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds and instantiates the corresponding
Date
c
object. Note that the month is 0-indexed in JavaScript, so 0 means January and 11 means December. Example:
new Date(2017, 5, 1)
c
gives
June 1st, 2017
i

title: Note that these examples were generated on a browser in the Central Time Zone of the US, during Daylight Time, as evidenced by the code. Where comparison with UTC was instructive,
Date.prototype.toISOString()
c
was used to show the date and time in UTC (the Z in the formatted string denotes UTC).
